content: KTH | Mathias Ekstedt Skip to main content Mathias EkstedtProfessorKungliga Tekniska Högskolanhttps://www.kth.se/profile/mekstedtDetailsWorks for Division of Network and Systems EngineeringTelephone +46 8 790 68 67Unit address Teknikringen 33E-mail mekstedt@kth.seResearcherResearcher IDORCID IDWeb of Science ResearcherIDScopus IDGoogle Scholar IDResearchGateAbout meMathias Ekstedt is Professor of Industrial Information and Control Systems at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. He received his M.Sc. and Ph.D. from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1999 and 2004 respectively. Mathias' research interests include information security and cybersecurity in combination with software and systems architecture modeling and analysis. Much of the research revolves around developing formalisms for analyzing security vulnerabilities of system-of-systems architectures trough the means of probabilistic attack/defense graphs. A corenerstone in this work is the Meta Attack Language (MAL). He has long history of collaborating with the power industry and apply the research to information systems related to physical process monitoring and control, such as SCADA and Industrial Control Systems. Mathias is the co-founder and director of KTH's Master programme in Cybersecurity, a member of the Trust Working Group in the Digital Futures research center, and a faculty member of the Center for Cyber Defense and Information Security (CDIS). Mathias is a co-founder of foreseeti, a company developing a cybersecurity analysis software product, that was acquired by Google in 2022. Organizationally he is a member of the Software Systems Architecture and Security (SSAS) research group within the Division of Network and Systems Engineering (NSE) at the Department of Computer Science in the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) at KTH.
